issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After upgrading from 3.2.2 to 3.3.0, Eucalyptus DNS fails to resolve.  Because of this issue, the perception was that the cloud was down - when in fact it was up and running.

To see the behavior, when EC2 URL points to a DNS name (for example):

{code}
EC2_URL=http://eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Eucalyptus
{code}

After sourcing the creds, and running _euca-describe-services_, the following is seen:

{code}
# euca-describe-services
[Errno -5] No address associated with hostname
{code}

If EC2 URL is changed to an IP address (e.g. http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Eucalyptus), re-sources the creds, and runs _euca-describe-services_, the results are what is expected:

{code}
# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatch:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	gza            	DISABLED  	31  	http://192.168.39.104:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:gza/
SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	rza            	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.103:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:rza/
SERVICE	autoscaling    	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscaling:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	iron-flag      	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:iron-flag/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	wu-tang-forever	DISABLED  	31  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:wu-tang-forever/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	NOTREADY  	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancing:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	storage        	enter-the-wu   	method-man     	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.103:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:storage:method-man/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Jetty	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	DISABLED  	31  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	ENABLED   	31  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.102/
{code}

_*NOTE*: Before the upgrade, Eucalyptus DNS resolution worked just fine._
fields.summary: After Upgrading from 3.2.2 to 3.3.0, Eucalyptus DNS fails to resolve
fields.environment:
*HA*

2 x CLC/Walrus
1 x SC/CC
1 x CC
3 x NCs

comments.body:
Hey Harold, can you tell me how you upgraded? I am unable to test this against latest packages. I installed 3.2.2 from packages (including enterprise libs) and upgraded to 3.3.0. These are my URLs for yum

baseurl=http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/builds/eucalyptus/commit/be3f5065a00a0b4c2ac6612c8dcbdf8e1b4a41fa-2013-05-22-001/centos/6/x86_64
baseurl=http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/builds/enterprise/commit/ed2cb59ed171002628333ed9ed606a8902a4887a-2013-05-22-001/centos/6/x86_64/

I restarted eucalyptus-cloud after upgrade, then tried to resolve using instance DNS as well as eucalyptus.domain

dig @192.168.51.97 euca-192-168-46-152.eucalyptus.hi.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.4 <<>> @192.168.51.97 euca-192-168-46-152.eucalyptus.hi.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 3230
;; flags: qr aa ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-192-168-46-152.eucalyptus.hi.com. IN A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euca-192-168-46-152.eucalyptus.hi.com. 604800 IN A 192.168.46.152

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
eucalyptus.hi.com.	604800	IN	NS	eucahost-51-97.eucalyptus.eucalyptus.hi.com.

;; Query time: 51 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.51.97#53(192.168.51.97)
;; WHEN: Wed May 22 09:46:01 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 111
[root@eucahost-51-97 yum.repos.d]# dig @192.168.51.97 eucalyptus.hi.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.4 <<>> @192.168.51.97 eucalyptus.hi.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 5404
;; flags: qr aa ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;eucalyptus.hi.com.		IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
eucalyptus.hi.com.	20	IN	A	192.168.51.97

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
eucalyptus.hi.com.	604800	IN	NS	eucahost-51-97.eucalyptus.eucalyptus.hi.com.

;; Query time: 14 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.51.97#53(192.168.51.97)
;; WHEN: Wed May 22 09:49:02 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 91

Hey [~neil],

I did the following steps:

* Stop the eucalyptus processes from the bottom up (stopping DISABLED components first)
** node1 - node3 => eucalyptus-nc stop
** viking04 => eucalyptus-cc cleanstop
** viking03 => eucalyptus-cloud stop (SC); eucalyptus-cc cleanstop
** viking01 => eucalyptus-cloud stop
** viking02 => eucalyptus-cloud stop (waited 2 minutes)

* Updated my yum configs for eucalyptus and euca2ools on all machines to the the following:
** mirrorlist=http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/api/1/genrepo/?distro=centos&releasever=6&arch=x86_64&url=repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com:eucalyptus&ref=testing&allow-old
** baseurl=http://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/gholms/cloud/epel-6/x86_64/

* Ran the following on all the machines:
** yum clean expire-cache
** yum update --nogpgcheck

* Started back up the components (starting with the machines that were ENABLED previously)
** viking02 => eucalyptus-cloud start (waited 2 minutes)
** viking01 => eucalyptus-cloud start
** viking03 => eucalyptus-cloud start (SC); eucalyptus-cc cleanstart
** viking04 => eucalyptus-cc cleanstart
** node1 - node3 => eucalyptus-nc start

Hope this helps.  Let me know if you have any questions.
Yeah that is essentially what I did. Do you have a system where this is trapped?

Okay, pretty sure this is the same as EUCA-6365

I just committed a fix. Please try now. Thanks!
I added it to the code, so you can try upgrading if packages are ready. Commit id is: be00baa3db6de9f18fc36bfc8c7728ae3d6d1a8f

Hey [~neil],

I upgraded the entire cloud:

eucalyptus-3.3.0-0.0.1032.20130528git7eb4642a.el6.x86_64

After the upgrade, I sourced the creds, using the DNS name for the EC2_URL, and I got the following error again:

{code}
# euca-describe-availability-zones
euca-describe-availability-zones: error: connection error
{code}

After that, I went back to setting the EC2_URL to the ENABLED CLC IP address (with /sevices/Eucalyptus), and tried to launch an instance.  I got the following error:

{code}
# euca-run-instances -k admin -t m1.xlarge emi-8EAA34C3
euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): class java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

Let me know if you need any additional information.  I attached additional sosreports from the ENABLED and DISABLED CLC/Walrus machines.

[~hspencer] 

Can we get access to the machines?

[~hspencer] [~neil]

Oddly I see the dns request for walrus succeed but for eucalyptus it fails.
{code}
[root@viking-02 ~]# nslookup eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
^[[A;; Got SERVFAIL reply from 192.168.7.1, trying next server
^[[A^C
[root@viking-02 ~]# nslookup walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Server:		192.168.7.1
Address:	192.168.7.1#53

Non-authoritative answer:
walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	canonical name = iron-flag.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com.
Name:	iron-flag.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 192.168.39.102

[root@viking-02 ~]#
[root@viking-02 ~]# nslookup eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
;; Got SERVFAIL reply from 192.168.7.1, trying next server
;; Got SERVFAIL reply from 10.1.1.254, trying next server
Server:		192.168.7.1
Address:	192.168.7.1#53

** server can't find eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com: NXDOMAIN

[root@viking-02 ~]#
{code}

Im not a DNS expert but I know this is always asked for:

{code}
[root@viking-02 ~]# dig +trace eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.4 <<>> +trace eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
;; global options: +cmd
.			479957	IN	NS	c.root-servers.net.
.			479957	IN	NS	f.root-servers.net.
.			479957	IN	NS	a.root-servers.net.

.			479957	IN	NS	l.root-servers.net.
;; Received 512 bytes from 192.168.7.1#53(192.168.7.1) in 517 ms

com.			172800	IN	NS	a.gtld-servers.net.
com.			172800	IN	NS	b.gtld-servers.net.
com.			172800	IN	NS	c.gtld-servers.net.

;; Received 129 bytes from 208.109.255.9#53(208.109.255.9) in 27 ms

[root@viking-02 ~]#
{code}
[~decker] has taken a look and after switching off "experimental.dns.services.enabled" was able to resolve properly. This led him to believe that there is an issue in our resolver.

Hey [~viglesias] and [~decker],

I got back on the system after the changes were made.  I was able to successfully describe the availability zone using the DNS name provided by Eucalyptus DNS for EC2_URL.

{code}
# echo $EC2_URL
http://eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Eucalyptus
# euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
AVAILABILITYZONE	enter-the-wu	192.168.39.103 arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:rza/
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- vm types	free / max   cpu   ram  disk
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.small	0018 / 0018   1    256     5
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- t1.micro	0018 / 0018   1    256     5
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.medium	0018 / 0018   1    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.medium	0009 / 0009   2    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.large	0009 / 0009   2    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.xlarge	0009 / 0009   2   1024    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.xlarge	0009 / 0009   2   2048    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.xlarge	0009 / 0009   2   2048    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.xlarge	0003 / 0003   4   2048    15
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.2xlarge	0003 / 0003   2   4096    30
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.2xlarge	0003 / 0003   4   4096    30
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   3072    60
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   4096    60
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hi1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   6144   120
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc2.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   6144   120
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cg1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   12288   200
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cr1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   16384   240
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hs1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  48   119808  24000
{code}

I still get the following error when I try to launch an instance:

{code}
# euca-run-instances -k admin -t m1.xlarge emi-8EAA34C3
euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): class java.lang.NullPointerException
# euca-run-instances -k admin --user-data-file cloud-init.config emi-C1613E67 --kernel eki-0F3937E9 --ramdisk eri-0BE53BFD
euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): class java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

Here is the error I see on the ENABLED CLC in the cloud-error.log:

{code}
Wed May 29 04:59:17 2013 ERROR [VmControl:VmControl.10] [com.eucalyptus.vm.VmControl.runInstances(VmControl.java):211] java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
Wed May 29 04:59:17 2013 ERROR [Allocations:VmControl.10] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.Allocations$Allocation.abort(Allocations.java):285] Aborting resource token: ResourceToken:i-362C3EE1:192.168.55.101:tag=95:idx=26
java.lang.RuntimeException

	at com.eucalyptus.vm.VmControl.runInstances(VmControl.java:212)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

	at org.mule.component.AbstractComponent.onCall(AbstractComponent.java:87)

	at org.mule.work.WorkerContext.run(WorkerContext.java:310)

	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:690)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)
{code}

Here is a more detailed thread from cloud-debug.log:

Based upon this error:

{code}
Wed May 29 05:01:53 2013  INFO [Address:VmControl.11] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.info(BaseRecord.java):173] :1369828913985:Address:790257eb-1705-4b1d-83ac-816114d3f4a2:arn:aws:euare:345590850920:user/admin:ADDRESS_STATE:TOP:Address 192.168.55.101 arn:aws:euare:000000000001:user/nobody available 0.0.0.0  AddressTransition system:unallocated->impending(true)
Wed May 29 05:01:54 2013 ERROR [VmControl:VmControl.11] [com.eucalyptus.vm.VmControl.runInstances(VmControl.java):211] java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

Looks like VmControl.java is having issues with assigning addresses to instances that are being launched.
[~neil], [~decker], we need to find out if this is fixable ASAP this morning.   Look at [~viglesias] notes on this, appears to be upgrade related.
Working to resolve underlying issue in 3.3.1
